sentence.Network_en: It was a luxury the 9 ragtag team obviously could not afford.
sentence.Network_cn: 对贫民队来说买一顶头盔显然是一种奢侈.

sentence.Network_en: They're a small ragtag army of racketeers, bandits, and murderers ( Thomas P. O'Neill , Jr )
sentence.Network_cn: 他们是诈骗犯 、 土匪和杀人犯组成的一小伙乌合之众 ( 小托马斯P. 奥涅尔 )

RelatedPhrase.word: a ragtag group of can-do ruffians

list.key: a ragtag group of can-do ruffians
list.abs: a ragtag group of can-do ruffians trying to compete in a world that just doesn't seem to care .一群底层人事想竞争大世界，好象也没人在乎乎他们。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: superseding earlier tag-rag and tag and rag (see rag, tag)

entry.def: If you want to say that a group of people or an organization is badly organized and not very respectable, you can describe it as a ragtag group or organization.

example.ex: We started out with a little rag-tag team of 30 people.
example.tran: 我们最初只是一支由30人组成的散兵游勇的队伍。

means.word_mean: 1. disparaging terms for the common people
